column4: im running ubuntu 11.04 and i made the mistake of not increasing the size of the partition. can i change the size without reformating?
Boot the LiveCD and use gparted to resize partition(s).
What method did you use to install Ubuntu 11.04?
Maybe you should re-state your question. (I am not sure I understand.)
Did you install from Ubuntu CD?
What did you download from ubuntu.com?  An ISO?
And did you burn this ISO image to a CD?
How did you install it?  From a CD?
What version of MS Windows do you have?
Oh ok.  Then this is what you  need: http://gparted.sourceforge.net/livecd.php
Yes, boot to the CD and you will be presented with a non-destructive partition manager called gparted.
But I recommend that you boot to MS Windows first and back any critical data and do defrag before attempting to re-size the MS Windows partition (assuming you are going to shrink it).
It is a relatively save proceedure, but...
